market_context: <cite index="4-4,4-9,4-10">Wall Street is positioned for a potential rebound after Monday's sharp sell-off, with the Dow falling 1.7% to 48,804.06, the S&P 500 dropping 1.04% to 6,837.75, and the Nasdaq declining 1.1% to 22,627.27</cite>. <cite index="4-1,4-5,4-6">Pre-market futures show cautious optimism with S&P 500 futures up 0.20%, Nasdaq-100 futures rising 0.30%, and Dow futures gaining 0.14%</cite>. <cite index="4-7">The sell-off was driven by renewed concerns about global trade policy and AI-led disruption in the software sector</cite>.

predictions.reasoning: <cite index="4-1,4-4,4-5">Pre-market futures are showing positive momentum with SPY futures up 0.20% after Monday's 1.04% decline, suggesting a technical rebound</cite>. <cite index="31-1,31-16,31-17">Consumer Confidence data at 10 AM ET is expected to improve to 87.6 from 84.5, which could provide market support as it's a key indicator for consumer spending</cite>.

<cite index="21-3,21-4">AMD announced a blockbuster deal with Meta to deploy 6 gigawatts of AI data center gear worth 'double-digit billions' per gigawatt over five years</cite>. <cite index="24-1,26-10">AMD has already surged 9.18% in pre-market trading, but the magnitude of this $60+ billion deal with equity warrants for 160 million shares provides strong fundamental support for further gains</cite>.

<cite index="4-1,4-5">Nasdaq-100 futures are leading the pre-market recovery with a 0.30% gain, outpacing both S&P 500 and Dow futures</cite>. <cite index="7-4,7-14,7-15">The AMD-Meta partnership announcement creating $100+ billion in AI infrastructure investment should benefit the broader tech sector that QQQ represents</cite>.

<cite index="5-1,5-2,5-3">Home Depot is up $9.70 in pre-market after beating earnings with EPS of $2.72 vs $2.54 expected and revenue of $38.2B vs $38.12B expected</cite>. <cite index="5-23,5-24,5-25">The company also raised its dividend to $2.33 per share and reported positive comparable sales growth of 0.4% for Q4 and 0.3% in the U.S.</cite>

<cite index="4-14">Nvidia shares were slightly lower pre-market as investors await its highly anticipated Q4 earnings report on Wednesday</cite>. <cite index="21-3,27-7,27-8">While Meta committed to using millions of Nvidia chips last week, the new AMD partnership represents competitive pressure and diversification away from Nvidia's dominance in AI chips</cite>.
